docs.title: Paul - The Ultimate Discord Bot for Moderation, Fun, and Utility
🤖 About Paul
docs.text:
Paul is a feature-rich, verified Discord bot designed to simplify server management, enhance community engagement, and provide powerful tools for moderation, fun, and utility. With a focus on ease of use and reliability, Paul integrates seamlessly into your server, offering a wide range of features that cater to both casual and professional communities.

Whether you're managing a gaming server, a professional workspace, or a casual hangout, Paul is here to help.

docs.title: 🔒 Advanced Moderation Tools
docs.text:
• Autorole System: Automatically assign roles to new members upon joining.
  • Timeouts and Bans: Temporarily or permanently remove disruptive users.
  • Message Purging: Quickly delete up to 500 messages in a channel.
  • Custom Automod Rules: Block specific words, links, or spam with ease.
  • Dynamic Moderation Buttons: Configure moderation settings directly in Discord using an intuitive button-based interface.

docs.title: 🎮 Clash of Clans Integration
docs.text:
• Fetch detailed stats for players and clans.
  • View war logs and clan performance.
  • Manage your Clash of Clans community directly from Discord.

docs.title: 🛠️ Utility Commands
docs.text:
• Ping: Check the bot's latency.
  • User Info: Fetch detailed information about a user.
  • Server Info: Get insights into your server's settings and statistics.
  • Avatar: Retrieve high-resolution profile pictures of users.

docs.title: 🎭 Fun Features
docs.text:
• Random Memes: Fetch memes from popular subreddits.
  • Customizable Greetings: Welcome new members with personalized messages.
  • Trivia and Games: Engage your community with fun games and trivia.

docs.title: 📜 Documentation and Support
docs.text:
• Comprehensive documentation available at lazowski.me.
  • Dedicated support via our Discord server.

docs.title: 1️⃣ Invite Paul to Your Server
docs.text: Click the button below to invite Paul to your server:

docs.title: 2️⃣ Configure Autorole
docs.text: Paul's Autorole system allows you to automatically assign roles to new members. To configure: 1. Use the /autorole command. 2. Select a role from the dropdown menu or configure settings using the intuitive button-based interface. 3. Save your settings, and you're good to go!

docs.title: 3️⃣ Set Up Modmail
docs.text: Paul includes a built-in Modmail system for seamless communication between moderators and members: 1. Use the /modmail command to open the Modmail interface. 2. Set the Modmail log channel using the /setmodmail command and selecting a channel. 3. Members can send messages directly to moderators using the /modmail command.

docs.title: 4️⃣ Explore Commands
docs.text: Paul comes with a wide range of commands for moderation, utility, and fun. Use /help in Discord to view the full list of commands.

docs.title: 🛠️ Moderation
docs.text: Command Description /ban @user Ban a user from the server. /kick @user Kick a user from the server. /timeout @user Temporarily mute a user. /purge <number> Delete a specified number of messages (up to 500). /lock #channel Lock a channel to prevent members from sending messages. /unlock #channel Unlock a previously locked channel. /announce #channel <message> Send an announcement message to a specific channel.

docs.title: 🎭 Fun & Utility
docs.text: Command Description /pfp @user Get a high-resolution avatar of a user. /ping Check the bot's latency. /dadjoke Fetch a random dad joke. /affirmation Get a positive affirmation to brighten your day. /clash Open the Clash of Clans features menu. /userinfo Get very thorough information about a user. /serverinfo Get very thorough information about a server.

docs.title: 🤖 Automation
docs.text: Command Description /autorole Configure auto-role settings for the server. /automod Manage AutoMod settings, including blocked words, links, and spam detection. /modmail Send a modmail message to the moderators. /setmodmail Set the modmail log channel for the server.

docs.title: 📝 Miscellaneous
docs.text: Command Description /help Display the bot's help message. /invite Get the bot's invite link. /support Get the link to the bot's support server. /source View the bot's source code and repository details. /paul View the bot's changelog and information. /test Test if the bot is working properly.

docs.title: Autorole System
docs.text: Paul's autorole system is fully customizable: - Use /autorole to toggle the system on or off. - Assign specific roles to new members. - Configure advanced settings like role hierarchy and exclusions.

docs.title: Custom Automod Rules
docs.text: Paul's Automod system allows you to: - Block specific words or phrases. - Prevent spam and repeated messages. - Automatically delete messages containing links or inappropriate content.

docs.title: Modmail
docs.text: Paul's Modmail system provides a direct line of communication between members and moderators: - Members can submit issues or concerns using a simple modal interface. - Moderators receive messages in a designated log channel.

docs.title: Why It's Necessary
docs.text: The bot requires access to the message_content intent to enable essential features for moderation, user interaction, and dynamic command handling. These features are critical for maintaining a safe and engaging environment in your server.

docs.title: Features Enabled by message_content
docs.text:
• Moderation Tools:
  • Detect and block inappropriate content (e.g., profanity, slurs, or malicious links).
  • Prevent spam and repeated messages.
  • Identify and mitigate message flooding or excessive emoji usage.
  • User Interaction:
  • Respond to mentions (e.g., @paul) with automated replies.
  • Enhance accessibility for new members by providing helpful responses.
  • Spam and Flood Detection:
  • Detect repeated or fast messages to prevent raids or spam attacks.
  • Alert moderators automatically when suspicious activity is detected.

docs.title: Privacy Commitment
docs.text: The bot only processes message content when necessary for the features described above. No message content is stored or logged beyond what is required for functionality. We are committed to ensuring user privacy and data security.

docs.title: Why It's Necessary
docs.text: The bot requires access to the guild_members intent to enable features that rely on member data. These features are essential for server management and moderation.

docs.title: Features Enabled by guild_members
docs.text:
• Autorole System:
  • Automatically assign roles to new members upon joining.
  • Member Tracking:
  • Detect when members join or leave the server.
  • Moderation Tools:
  • Enable commands like /timeout, /ban, and /kick that depend on member information.
  • User Information:
  • Fetch member details for commands like /modmail and /userinfo.

docs.title: Privacy Commitment
docs.text: The bot only processes member data when necessary for the features described above. No member data is stored or logged beyond what is required for functionality. We are committed to ensuring user privacy and data security.
